#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <ctype.h>

// Define the Task structure
typedef struct {
    int time;
    int duration;
    int index;
} Task;

// Define the queue structure
typedef struct {
    Task *tasks;
    int front;
    int rear;
    int capacity;
    int size;
} Queue;

// Function to create a queue of given capacity
Queue* createQueue(int capacity) {
    Queue* queue = (Queue*)malloc(sizeof(Queue));
    queue->capacity = capacity;
    queue->front = 0;
    queue->rear = capacity - 1;
    queue->size = 0;
    queue->tasks = (Task*)malloc(queue->capacity * sizeof(Task));
    return queue;
}

// Function to check if the queue is full
int isFull(Queue* queue) {
    return (queue->size == queue->capacity);
}

// Function to check if the queue is empty
int isEmpty(Queue* queue) {
    return (queue->size == 0);
}

// Function to add an item to the queue
void enqueue(Queue* queue, Task item) {
    if (isFull(queue)) {
        // Handle error, but assuming capacity is sufficient
        return;
    }
    queue->rear = (queue->rear + 1) % queue->capacity;
    queue->tasks[queue->rear] = item;
    queue->size++;
}

// Function to remove an item from the queue
Task dequeue(Queue* queue) {
    if (isEmpty(queue)) {
        // Handle error
        Task dummy = {0,0,0};
        return dummy;
    }
    Task item = queue->tasks[queue->front];
    queue->front = (queue->front + 1) % queue->capacity;
    queue->size--;
    return item;
}

// Function to get queue size
int queueSize(Queue* queue) {
    return queue->size;
}

// Function to process a task from the queue and update finish_time and result
void runTask(Queue* remaining, int* finish_time, int* result) {
    Task task = dequeue(remaining);
    int start_time = (*finish_time > task.time) ? *finish_time : task.time;
    *finish_time = start_time + task.duration;
    result[task.index] = *finish_time;
}
